Unfolding the Fourth Dimension: How to Render a Tesseract in 2D

Unveiling the Dimensional Enigma: Simplifying the Tesseract's Complexity through 2D Visualization

The Goal

The System contains a canvas using a 2D rendering context. The goal is to be able to render a simple 4 dimensional hypercube (also known as a tesseract) and being able to rotate it around all four dimensions.

The rendering context of the canvas should not be changed and the tesseract should be painted unto a two dimensional canvas.

The Problem

Most people are not able to imagine being able to see a fourth dimension. This paper should give a small insight on how 4 dimensional rendering could be approached.

Demonstration

Using vanilla TypeScript and some basic math we can calculate how to render a four dimensional shape on a two dimensional plane.
